title: Supermodel Candice Swanepoel Takes A Spill On NYFW Runway
content:
South African supermodel Candice Swanepoel took a tumble on the runway Friday night while showing off the latest fashions from Givenchy during New York Fashion Week. 

Swanepoel was left with bloodied knees after the fall, which she appeared to laugh about as she was helped up, and she shared a photo of her battle wounds on Instagram. 

“Thank you to who ever picked me up off the runway tonight. Left with little scratches but mostly a bruised ego #ohwell,” she wrote. 

The model, sporting nearly unrecognizable bleached eyebrows, wore a lace dress and shows with lots of fringes on them, which appeared to cause her fall. Fortunately a couple of audience members quickly helped her to her feet and she went on to finish the show. 

She wasn’t the only one to fall either. The show was held at New York City’s Pier 26 and the runway was concrete, hence Candice’s cuts, and had a series of wooden pallets stacked like steps for the models to climb over. One model got tripped up on her shoes also but managed to avoid falling on the concrete as some quick members of the audience were able to grab her and help her up as she slipped going down the makeshift steps. 

Note to Givenchy: walking around with untied shoes is not fashion, it’s just stupid.
